intro: Mimulus platylaemus, commonly known as the yellow monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that resemble small monkey faces, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as stream banks and meadows. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. Mimulus platylaemus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also important in ecological settings for supporting pollinators.
